intro: Microlicia pataroi, commonly known as the Pataroi microlicia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and simple, opposite leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Microlicia pataroi is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
